What photo library software do you use?
description:
As the subject goes, I’m curious what photo library software do you use?

I’m using Nextcloud to store the photos from my and my partner’s phone, usually photos of our kids. We don’t actually view then on Nextcloud (the interface is too clunky), so NC behaves more as a backup for our iPhone and Android phones. However, these phones have memory limits which we both are now approaching. So I’m looking for something that could replace our current setup.

What I think I’m looking for is:

  • I can run the server locally
  • it has good facial recognition (mostly searching for family member combinations)
  • it has geo tagging for photos
  • old photos can be offloaded off the phone, but still accessible
  • photos from different phones can be combined into one store
  • phone apps have options to show what happened on some days in the past
description_plain:
As the subject goes, I'm curious what photo library software do you use?

I'm using Nextcloud to store the photos from my and my partner's phone, usually photos of our kids. We don't actually view then on Nextcloud (the interface is too clunky), so NC behaves more as a backup for our iPhone and Android phones. However, these phones have memory limits which we both are now approaching. So I'm looking for something that could replace our current setup.

What I think I'm looking for is:

- I can run the server locally
- it has good facial recognition (mostly searching for family member combinations)
- it has geo tagging for photos
- old photos can be offloaded off the phone, but still accessible
- photos from different phones can be combined into one store
- phone apps have options to show what happened on some days in the past

title: A Definition of Magic in Programming Languages

Are there languages with first class table support, similar to struct or map?
description:
I’m wondering if there are any statically typed languages out there that natively support tables, like SQL does.

Consider this pseudocode for defining a Car struct:

    type Car struct {
        manufacturer string
        model string
        year int
    }

Now, I’m looking for a table type like this:

    type Cars table {
        row Car
        primary key [row.manufacturer, row.model, row.year]
        yearIndex index [row.year]
    }

Then I could do things like:

    var cars Cars
    cars.insert(Car{
        manufacturer: "Porsche",
        model: "911",
        year: 2018,
    })
    print(cars.yearIndex[2018])

Any language you are aware of that does something similar?
description_plain:

Consider this pseudocode for defining a Car struct:

        type Car struct {
            manufacturer string

Now, I'm looking for a table type like this:

        type Cars table {

            primary key [row.manufacturer, row.model, row.year]
            yearIndex index [row.year]
        }

Then I could do things like:

        var cars Cars
        cars.insert(Car{
            manufacturer: "Porsche",
            model: "911",
            year: 2018,
        })
        print(cars.yearIndex[2018])

Any language you are aware of that does something similar?
